metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1654 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The media subsystem in Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.75 does notinitialize an unspecified data structure, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (invalid read operation) via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1117
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1117
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1117
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1117
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1117
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1117').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
